senses.de: Expected to do something in the future
senses.ex: She's a prospective student trying to get into the best university.

Tips.title: Future Intentions
Tips.description: Use 'prospective' to talk about someone's plans or intentions for the coming time.
Tips.example: She visited the campus as a prospective student, hoping to enroll next term.

Tips.title: Engagement Stage
Tips.description: Indicates someone's position when considering or negotiating an action but hasn't committed yet.
Tips.example: The prospective employer had a long interview with him.

Tips.title: Anticipating Participation
Tips.description: 'Prospective' often implies someone is taking steps to achieve a future goal.
Tips.example: She already attended the pre-orientation meetup for prospective members.

senses.ex: These new technologies show prospective benefits for all of us.

Tips.title: Near-term Likelihood
Tips.description: Employ 'prospective' for events that are likely to occur soon.
Tips.example: The prospective law changes could affect many businesses.

Tips.title: Expecting Outcomes
Tips.description: Describes outcomes that are looked forward to or expected in the near future.
Tips.example: We discussed the prospective advantages of the new system.

Tips.title: Upcoming Possibilities
Tips.description: Refers to future scenarios that are possible and often being prepared for.
Tips.example: They invested in new equipment for the prospective increase in demand.

senses.de: Relating to or effective in the future
senses.ex: The pros and cons of the prospective situation must be analyzed.

Tips.title: Future Impact
Tips.description: Refers to how something will affect matters in the future, not immediately.
Tips.example: The CEO spoke about the prospective impact of the merger.

Tips.title: Vision of the Future
Tips.description: Used when describing a vision or a plan that someone has mind for the future.
Tips.example: The architect shared his prospective design for the new park.

Tips.title: Forward Thinking
Tips.description: Shows an orientation towards the future, especially in planning and decision-making.
Tips.example: Our team's prospective strategy aims to reduce expenses over the next five years.

Anticipate.wordDefinition:
Anticipate means to be prepared for something or to expect it to happen in the future, based on knowledge or experience.

It is applicable when you have a good idea of what might happen and you are getting ready for it. For example, you might anticipate that it will rain tomorrow and bring an umbrella.

Future.wordDefinition:
Future refers to the time that is yet to come. It is a general term used when we are talking about what will happen next in the course of events.

For example, "In the future, we will have flying cars".

Future refers to the time ahead while prospective refers to the potential outcome of a situation.

Imminent.wordDefinition:
Imminent refers to something that is about to happen or occur very soon, often with a sense of urgency or impending danger.

For example, a storm that is approaching can be described as imminent.

Prospective refers to something that is likely or expected to happen in the future. It does not necessarily have the same urgency or immediacy as something imminent.

Imminent describes something that is about to happen soon, while prospective describes something that is likely or expected to happen in the future.

Impending.wordDefinition:
Impending means that something is about to happen very soon. For example, an impending storm means that a storm is very likely to arrive in the near future.

Impending refers to something that is almost certain to happen very soon while prospective refers to something that is possible or likely to happen in the future.

Likely.wordDefinition:
Likely means that something is probable or expected to happen.

For example: It is likely to rain tomorrow.

Prospective means something is possible or likely to happen in the future. It refers to a situation that one is considering as a potential course of action.

Likely refers to something that is probable or expected to happen, while prospective refers to something that has the potential to happen in the future.

Possible.wordDefinition:
Possible means that something could happen, but it is not certain. It describes something that could be done or achieved if the right conditions are met, but it may not necessarily happen.

For example, it is possible for someone to win the lottery, but it is not guaranteed or prospective. Winning the lottery would only become prospective if that person had a winning ticket or if they had a very high chance of winning based on some statistical analysis.

Possible describes something that could happen, while prospective describes something that is expected or likely to happen in the future.

Potential.wordDefinition:
Potential means the possibility of something happening or becoming actual in the future. For example, a student has the potential to become a successful doctor.

Potential refers to the possibility of something happening, while prospective refers to something that is likely to happen or become a specific thing in the future.

Probably.wordDefinition:
Probably means that something is likely or expected to happen, but it is not certain. For example, if you say "It will probably rain tomorrow," you mean it is likely to rain, but you are not completely sure.

Probably is used to express a likely but uncertain outcome, while prospective describes something that is being considered as a possibility in the future.

quotes.Text: Unlike public universities and private, not-for-profit colleges, for-profit schools are owned by revenue-seeking businesses often more intent on boosting their bottom line than educating their students. They use hard-sell tactics to recruit prospective students, and veterans have become particular targets.
quotes.Title: American Public Servant
quotes.Name: Lisa Madigan

quotes.Text: Blogging is a great way to show your talents and interests to prospective employers, while adding an edge to your resume. If you blog consistently it shows your dedication, passions and creativity - all of which are key attributes employers look for in job candidates.
quotes.Title: American Designer
quotes.Name: Lauren Conrad

quotes.Text: If a prospective Presidential approach can't be explained clearly enough to be understood well, it probably hasn't been thought through well enough. If not well understood by the American people, it probably won't 'sail' anyway. Send it back for further thought.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Donald Rumsfeld

quotes.Text: The relationship between a manufacturer and his advertising agency is almost as intimate as the relationship between a patient and his doctor. Make sure that you can life happily with your prospective client before you accept his account.
quotes.Title: English Businessman
quotes.Name: David Ogilvy

quotes.Text: By providing our school districts with direct access to criminal information records, we can help ensure timely and complete information on prospective school employees.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Jon Porter

quotes.Text: I have a theory about that, if you have to say something, if you have encourage for one second a prospective acting student - he should not go in to acting.

quotes.Text: What an unappealing responsibility that is to lumber any prospective lover with: the need to be a saviour, not simply an equal partner.

quotes.Text: We tell prospective hires, 'If you want an environment that is never going to change, don't come here. This is not the place for you.

quotes.Name: Michael Dell

quotes.Text: Never get married in college; it's hard to get a start if a prospective employer finds you've already made one mistake.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.Text: For charity purposes, how do I help? A lot of prospective levers and tools have come into my life.
